refnamediv.refpurpose: an object that represents a language tag.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: A pango.Language object represents a language tag meeting the RFC-3066 standard. The pango.Language can be retrieved from a pango.Context by using the pango.Context.get_language() method or created using the pango.Language() constructor. Eaxmple RFC-3066 languange tags include: "en-us", "fr", and "sgn-us-ma".

refsect1.title: Constructor

listitem.simpara: a string representing a language tag

refsect1.para: Creates a new pango.Language object from the RFC-3066 language tag specified by language. This constructor first canonicalizes the string in language by converting it to lowercase, mapping '_' to '-', and stripping all characters other than letters and '-'.

refsect2.title: pango.Language.matches

listitem.simpara: a list of language ranges, separated by ';' characters.
TRUE if a match was found.

refsect2.para: The matches() method returns TRUE if the language matches one of the language ranges in the list specified by range_list.A language tag is considered to match a range in the list if

listitem.simpara: the range is exactly the same as the tag, or
the range is a prefix of the tag, and the character after the matching portion of the tag is '-'

refsect2.para: each range must either be '*', or a canonicalized RFC-3066 language range (see the pango.Language() constructor for more information).

refsect2.title: pango.Language.matches

listitem.simpara: the string representation of the language tag

refsect2.para: The to_string() method returns a string representation of the canonicalized language tag. See the pango.Language() constructor for more information.
